rok commented on pull request #6443: ARROW-6393: [C++] Add EqualOptions support in SparseTensor::Equals
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6443#discussion_r383045309
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/compare.cc
 ##########
 @@ -1053,10 +1053,13 @@ bool IntegerTensorEquals(const Tensor& left, const Tensor& right) {
 }
 
 template <typename DataType>
-bool StridedFloatTensorContentEquals(const int dim_index, int64_t left_offset,
-                                     int64_t right_offset, const Tensor& left,
-                                     const Tensor& right, const EqualOptions& opts) {
+bool StridedFloatingTensorContentEquals(const int dim_index, int64_t left_offset,
 
 Review comment:
   Just a nit I'd prefer `StridedFloatTensorContentEquals` over `StridedFloatingTensorContentEquals` and "float type" over "floating point type", etc. as that is what I my eyes are more used to.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

mrkn commented on pull request #6443: ARROW-6393: [C++] Add EqualOptions support in SparseTensor::Equals
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6443#discussion_r383063097
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/compare.cc
 ##########
 @@ -1053,10 +1053,13 @@ bool IntegerTensorEquals(const Tensor& left, const Tensor& right) {
 }
 
 template <typename DataType>
-bool StridedFloatTensorContentEquals(const int dim_index, int64_t left_offset,
-                                     int64_t right_offset, const Tensor& left,
-                                     const Tensor& right, const EqualOptions& opts) {
+bool StridedFloatingTensorContentEquals(const int dim_index, int64_t left_offset,
 
 Review comment:
   I didn't think `floating` is better than `float`.
   The reason why I rename it was just to follow the `is_floating_type` function.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

rok commented on pull request #6443: ARROW-6393: [C++] Add EqualOptions support in SparseTensor::Equals
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6443#discussion_r383194053
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/compare.cc
 ##########
 @@ -1053,10 +1053,13 @@ bool IntegerTensorEquals(const Tensor& left, const Tensor& right) {
 }
 
 template <typename DataType>
-bool StridedFloatTensorContentEquals(const int dim_index, int64_t left_offset,
-                                     int64_t right_offset, const Tensor& left,
-                                     const Tensor& right, const EqualOptions& opts) {
+bool StridedFloatingTensorContentEquals(const int dim_index, int64_t left_offset,
 
 Review comment:
   Arrow has both [`is_floating_type`](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/arrow/type_traits.h#L442) and [`is_half_float_type`](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/arrow/type_traits.h#L450) which seems  inconsistent to me.
   `is_floating_point` probably comes from flatbuffers?
   Perhaps @fsaintjacques has an opinion on this?
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

 }

-                                     int64_t right_offset, const Tensor& left,
-                                     const Tensor& right, const EqualOptions& opts) {
+bool StridedFloatingTensorContentEquals(const int dim_index, int64_t left_offset,
 
 Review comment:
   I would favour "float" rather than "floating" as well, FWIW.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

pitrou commented on pull request #6443: ARROW-6393: [C++] Add EqualOptions support in SparseTensor::Equals
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6443#discussion_r383258917
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/compare.cc
 ##########
 @@ -1207,12 +1255,13 @@ inline bool SparseTensorEqualsImplDispatch(const SparseTensorImpl<SparseIndexTyp
 
 }  // namespace
 
-bool SparseTensorEquals(const SparseTensor& left, const SparseTensor& right) {
-  if (&left == &right) {
+bool SparseTensorEquals(const SparseTensor& left, const SparseTensor& right,
+                        const EqualOptions& opts) {
+  if (is_integer(left.type()->id()) && &left == &right) {
 
 Review comment:
   You can probably move this shortcut into `IntegerSparseTensorDataEquals` and `FloatingSparseTensorDataEquals` (so that you can also enable the shortcut for FP values if `nans_equal` is true).

fields.description: SparseTensor::Equals should take EqualOptions argument as Tensor::Equals does.
